_ros_interface.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 """
2 This handles the base behavior of manipulating time and interfacing with ROS.
3 It gets subclassed to customize it to a specific ROS network's environment.
4 
5 License:
6  BSD 3-Clause License
7  Copyright (c) 2023, Autonomous Robotics Club of Purdue (Purdue ARC)
8  All rights reserved.
9 """
10 
11 from abc import abstractmethod
12 from threading import Condition
13 import time, uuid, socket, os
14 
15 from gym import Env
16 
17 import rospy, roslaunch
18 from rosgraph_msgs.msg import Clock
19 from diagnostic_msgs.msg import DiagnosticStatus, KeyValue
20 
21 class SimTimeException(Exception):
22  """For when advancing sim time does not go as planned."""
23  pass
24 
25 class ROSInterface(Env):
26  """Extension of the Gym environment class for all specific interfaces
27  to extend. This class handles logic regarding timesteps in ROS, and
28  allows users to treat any ROS system as a Gym environment once the
29  interface is created.
30 
31  All classes extending this for a particular environment must do the following:
32  - implement all abstract properties:
33  - action_space
34  - observation_space
35  - implement all abstract methods:
36  - _reset_env()
37  - _reset_self()
38  - _has_state()
39  - _clear_state()
40  - _get_state()
41  - _publish_action()
42  - notify _cond when _has_state() may have turned true
43  """
44 
45  def __init__(self, node_name='gym_interface', eval=False, launch_file=None, launch_args=[], run_id=None):
46  """init function
47  Params:
48  node_name: desired name of this node in the ROS network
49  eval: set true if evaluating an agent in an existing ROS env, set false if training an agent
50  launch_file: if training, launch file to be used (ex: ['rktl_autonomy', 'rocket_league_train.launch'])
51  launch_args: if training, arguments to be passed to roslaunch (ex: ['render:=true', rate:=10])
52  run_id: if training, used to prevent deadlocks. if logging, run_id describes where to save files. Default is randomly generated
53  """
54  super().__init__()
55  self.__EVAL_MODE = eval
56 
57  # ROS initialization
58  if not self.__EVAL_MODE:
59  assert launch_file is not None
60  assert run_id is not None
61  # use temporary files to enforce one environment roslaunching at a time
62  while True:
63  try:
64  open(f'/tmp/{run_id}_launch', mode='x')
65  break
66  except FileExistsError:
67  pass
68  # find a free port (using default if available)
69  port = 11311
70  with socket.socket() as sock:
71  try:
72  # see if default port is available
73  sock.bind(('localhost', port))
74  except socket.error:
75  # find a random open one
76  sock.bind(('localhost', 0))
77  port = sock.getsockname()[1]
78  # launch the training ROS network
79  ros_id = roslaunch.rlutil.get_or_generate_uuid(None, False)
80  roslaunch.configure_logging(ros_id)
81  launch_file = roslaunch.rlutil.resolve_launch_arguments(launch_file)[0]
82  launch_args = [f'render:={port==11311}', f'plot_log:={port==11311}'] + launch_args + [f'agent_name:={node_name}']
83  launch = roslaunch.parent.ROSLaunchParent(ros_id, [(launch_file, launch_args)], port=port)
84  launch.start()
85  self.close = lambda : launch.shutdown()
86  # initialize self
87  os.environ['ROS_MASTER_URI'] = f'http://localhost:{port}'
88  rospy.init_node(node_name)
89  # let someone else take a turn
90  os.remove(f'/tmp/{run_id}_launch')
91  else:
92  # use an existing ROS network
93  rospy.init_node(node_name)
94 
95  # private variables
96  self._cond = Condition()
97 
98  # additional set up for training
99  if not self.__EVAL_MODE:
100  self.__DELTA_T = rospy.Duration.from_sec(1.0 / rospy.get_param('~rate', 30.0))
101  self.__clock_pub = rospy.Publisher('/clock', Clock, queue_size=1, latch=True)
102 
103  # initialize sim time
104  self.__time = rospy.Time.from_sec(time.time())
105  self.__clock_pub.publish(self.__time)
106 
107  # additional set up for logging
108  if run_id is None:
109  run_id = uuid.uuid4()
110  if self.__EVAL_MODE:
111  port = 11311
112  self.__LOG_ID = f'{run_id}:{port}'
113  self.__log_pub = rospy.Publisher('~log', DiagnosticStatus, queue_size=1)
114  self.__episode = 0
115  self.__net_reward = 0
116  self.__start_time = rospy.Time.now()
117 
118  def step(self, action):
119  """
120  Implementation of gym.Env.step. This function will intentionally block
121  if the ROS environment is not ready.
122 
123  Run one timestep of the environment's dynamics. When end of
124  episode is reached, you are responsible for calling `reset()`
125  to reset this environment's state.
126  Accepts an action and returns a tuple (observation, reward, done, info).
127  Args:
128  action (object): an action provided by the agent
129  Returns:
130  observation (object): agent's observation of the current environment
131  reward (float) : amount of reward returned after previous action
132  done (bool): whether the episode has ended, in which case further step() calls will return undefined results
133  info (dict): contains auxiliary diagnostic information (helpful for debugging, and sometimes learning)
134  """
135  self._clear_state()
136  self._publish_action(action)
137  self.__step_time_and_wait_for_state()
138  state = self._get_state()
139  self.__net_reward += state[1] # logging
140  return state
141 
142  def reset(self):
143  """Resets the environment to an initial state and returns an initial observation.
144 
145  Note that this function should not reset the environment's random
146  number generator(s); random variables in the environment's state should
147  be sampled independently between multiple calls to `reset()`. In other
148  words, each call of `reset()` should yield an environment suitable for
149  a new episode, independent of previous episodes.
150  Returns:
151  observation (object): the initial observation.
152  """
153  if self._has_state():
154  # generate log
155  info = {
156  'episode' : self.__episode,
157  'net_reward' : self.__net_reward,
158  'duration' : (rospy.Time.now() - self.__start_time).to_sec()
159  }
160  info.update(self._get_state()[3])
161  # send message
162  msg = DiagnosticStatus()
163  msg.level = DiagnosticStatus.OK
164  msg.name = 'ROS-Gym Interface'
165  msg.message = 'log of episode data'
166  msg.hardware_id = self.__LOG_ID
167  msg.values = [KeyValue(key=key, value=str(value)) for key, value in info.items()]
168  self.__log_pub.publish(msg)
169  # update variables (update time after reset)
170  self.__episode += 1
171  self.__net_reward = 0
172 
173  # reset
174  if not self.__EVAL_MODE:
175  self._reset_env()
176  self._reset_self()
177  self.__step_time_and_wait_for_state(5)
178  self.__start_time = rospy.Time.now() # logging
179  return self._get_state()[0]
180 
181  def __step_time_and_wait_for_state(self, max_retries=1):
182  """Step time until a state is known."""
183  if not self.__EVAL_MODE:
184  self.__time += self.__DELTA_T
185  self.__clock_pub.publish(self.__time)
186  retries = 0
187  while not self.__wait_once_for_state():
188  if retries >= max_retries:
189  rospy.logerr("Failed to get new state.")
190  raise SimTimeException
191  else:
192  self.__time += self.__DELTA_T
193  self.__clock_pub.publish(self.__time)
194  retries += 1
195  else:
196  while not self.__wait_once_for_state():
197  pass # idle wait
198 
199  def __wait_once_for_state(self):
200  """Wait and allow other threads to run."""
201  with self._cond:
202  has_state = self._cond.wait_for(self._has_state, 0.25)
203  if rospy.is_shutdown():
204  raise rospy.ROSInterruptException()
205  return has_state
206 
207  # All the below abstract methods / properties must be implemented by subclasses
208  @property
209  @abstractmethod
210  def action_space(self):
211  """The Space object corresponding to valid actions."""
212  raise NotImplementedError
213 
214  @property
215  @abstractmethod
216  def observation_space(self):
217  """The Space object corresponding to valid observations."""
218  raise NotImplementedError
219 
220  @abstractmethod
221  def _reset_env(self):
222  """Reset environment for a new episode."""
223  raise NotImplementedError
224 
225  @abstractmethod
226  def _reset_self(self):
227  """Reset internally for a new episode."""
228  raise NotImplementedError
229 
230  @abstractmethod
231  def _has_state(self):
232  """Determine if the new state is ready."""
233  raise NotImplementedError
234 
235  @abstractmethod
236  def _clear_state(self):
237  """Clear state variables / flags in preparation for new ones."""
238  raise NotImplementedError
239 
240  @abstractmethod
241  def _get_state(self):
242  """Get state tuple (observation, reward, done, info)."""
243  raise NotImplementedError
244 
245  @abstractmethod
246  def _publish_action(self, action):
247  """Publish an action to the ROS network."""
248  raise NotImplementedError
